# 

<span key="51e0452293d741f3951b751c660d7e0f"><span offset-key="51e0452293d741f3951b751c660d7e0f:0">Gatsby</span></span>

<span key="e71dda07ae4d46c488abaa0be3a89459"><span offset-key="e71dda07ae4d46c488abaa0be3a89459:0">This guide will help you get started using Netlify CMS and Gatsby.</span></span>

<span key="0ec39cf215964b9b8daca0e6f9f37150"><span offset-key="0ec39cf215964b9b8daca0e6f9f37150:0">To get up and running with Gatsby, you’ll need to have </span></span><a href="https://nodejs.org" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="c9edc7e9453748d29b45d57bddebfd07" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="4ab5944ed54e48a3a931fd436473c54b"><span data-offset-key="4ab5944ed54e48a3a931fd436473c54b:0">Node.js</span></span></span></a><span key="25f3df45e0b8408db236a4f525b43515"><span offset-key="25f3df45e0b8408db236a4f525b43515:0"> installed on your computer. </span>*Note: Gatsby's minimum supported Node.js version is Node 8.*</span>

## 

<span key="3659ac1244a34c3882de6e9d4eb5167f"><span offset-key="3659ac1244a34c3882de6e9d4eb5167f:0">Create a new Gatsby site</span></span>

<span key="9b7c6ae701f6422991b42f82c9c08dab"><span offset-key="9b7c6ae701f6422991b42f82c9c08dab:0">Let's create a new site using the default Gatsby Starter Blog. Run the following commands in the terminal, in the folder where you'd like to create the blog:</span></span>

1

<span key="33e92c66b4ec4d4c82561ae6806c87ed"><span offset-key="33e92c66b4ec4d4c82561ae6806c87ed:0">npm install -g gatsby-cli</span></span>

2

<span key="cb2149ce3c534f588615f6c3a643d52e"><span offset-key="cb2149ce3c534f588615f6c3a643d52e:0">gatsby new blog https://github.com/gatsbyjs/gatsby-starter-blog</span></span>

3

<span key="eec19032132a4b33b93b23bd30658ac7"><span offset-key="eec19032132a4b33b93b23bd30658ac7:0">cd blog</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7" />

Copied!

## 

<span key="464d09009941439196d6dff8a5f5c657"><span offset-key="464d09009941439196d6dff8a5f5c657:0">Get to know Gatsby</span></span>

<span key="61aa0112eba34163a40b46c3224a49ef"><span offset-key="61aa0112eba34163a40b46c3224a49ef:0">In your favorite code editor, open up the code generated for your "Gatsby Starter Blog" site, and take a look at the </span>`content`<span offset-key="61aa0112eba34163a40b46c3224a49ef:2"> directory.</span></span>

<span key="822b8613471b4a6c89e4e36563b93d63"><span offset-key="822b8613471b4a6c89e4e36563b93d63:0">You will see that there are multiple Markdown files that represent blog posts. Open one </span>`.md`<span offset-key="822b8613471b4a6c89e4e36563b93d63:2"> file and you will see something like this:</span></span>

1

<span key="5de689c7693648cb9589cfc8c4f000cc"><span offset-key="5de689c7693648cb9589cfc8c4f000cc:0">---</span></span>

2

<span key="15e8ebda9c314847b1d157023a13f18e"><span offset-key="15e8ebda9c314847b1d157023a13f18e:0">title: New Beginnings</span></span>

3

<span key="41ae3ba65f0f46fca5c72483975b18dc"><span offset-key="41ae3ba65f0f46fca5c72483975b18dc:0">date: "2015-05-28T22:40:32.169Z"</span></span>

4

<span key="a347e5a67f354661843ef19551fad649"><span offset-key="a347e5a67f354661843ef19551fad649:0">description: This is an optional description for SEO and Open Graph purposes, rather than the default generated excerpt.</span></span>

5

<span key="8a79701f137c414ba8a858decca3e10d"><span offset-key="8a79701f137c414ba8a858decca3e10d:0">---</span></span>

6

<span key="05dc36b6a4b24623a4592cdb1a6d88e6"><span offset-key="05dc36b6a4b24623a4592cdb1a6d88e6:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

7

<span key="4ca051b20b8847f79b47321616864eb4"><span offset-key="4ca051b20b8847f79b47321616864eb4:0">Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia and</span></span>

8

<span key="9c971424ca1f447f8076ff3c6a16132d"><span offset-key="9c971424ca1f447f8076ff3c6a16132d:0">Consonantia, there live the blind texts.</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="0b3b9b5167e74a4da272a0b52421bc67"><span offset-key="0b3b9b5167e74a4da272a0b52421bc67:0">We can see above that each blog post has a title, a date, a description and a body. Now, let's recreate this using Netlify CMS.</span></span>

## 

<span key="8f72f448815b477ca029608b309aad8c"><span offset-key="8f72f448815b477ca029608b309aad8c:0">Add Netlify CMS to your site</span></span>

<span key="bd87ae89d9d7459a81052e09d1e33314"><span offset-key="bd87ae89d9d7459a81052e09d1e33314:0">First let's install some dependencies. We'll need </span>`netlify-cms-app`<span offset-key="bd87ae89d9d7459a81052e09d1e33314:2"> and </span>`gatsby-plugin-netlify-cms`<span offset-key="bd87ae89d9d7459a81052e09d1e33314:4">. Run the following command in the terminal at the root of your site:</span></span>

1

<span key="bbfb8361cafe47f3a1c9b79047409988"><span offset-key="bbfb8361cafe47f3a1c9b79047409988:0">npm install --save netlify-cms-app gatsby-plugin-netlify-cms</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

### 

<span key="1cca5b61676d4a78a357a8c6b3c13de6"><span offset-key="1cca5b61676d4a78a357a8c6b3c13de6:0">Configuration</span></span>

<span key="08a2d608ed7544138b6a97963b849874"><span offset-key="08a2d608ed7544138b6a97963b849874:0">For the purpose of this guide we will deploy to Netlify from a GitHub repository which requires the minimum configuration.</span></span>

<span key="7280a682328d45c8b0394616335a2d8e"><span offset-key="7280a682328d45c8b0394616335a2d8e:0">Create a </span>`config.yml`<span offset-key="7280a682328d45c8b0394616335a2d8e:2"> file in the directory structure you see below:</span></span>

1

<span key="f195786efec145dbb08d10dcc51ed746"><span offset-key="f195786efec145dbb08d10dcc51ed746:0">├── static</span></span>

2

<span key="448ad6bcbd494040b32987235512420b"><span offset-key="448ad6bcbd494040b32987235512420b:0">│ ├── admin</span></span>

3

<span key="175a4153626544729b6e85b65342ebe5"><span offset-key="175a4153626544729b6e85b65342ebe5:0">│ │ ├── config.yml</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="12742b7a79044727b5857cc59c200429"><span offset-key="12742b7a79044727b5857cc59c200429:0">In your </span>`config.yml`<span offset-key="12742b7a79044727b5857cc59c200429:2"> file paste the following configuration:</span></span>

1

<span key="e883c2f6a1f2489d83bbd3bdf0b4a063"><span offset-key="e883c2f6a1f2489d83bbd3bdf0b4a063:0">backend:</span></span>

2

<span key="6e6d5a8a503a4c309d91ddae07bd808b"><span offset-key="6e6d5a8a503a4c309d91ddae07bd808b:0"> name: git-gateway</span></span>

3

<span key="f50b93ba64924a429b246e8a024c6b35"><span offset-key="f50b93ba64924a429b246e8a024c6b35:0"> branch: main # Branch to update (optional; defaults to master)</span></span>

4

<span key="c1ccde5934b64def8f177b38ff1b78dd"><span offset-key="c1ccde5934b64def8f177b38ff1b78dd:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

5

<span key="7facad62859e471880899c354da86062"><span offset-key="7facad62859e471880899c354da86062:0">media\_folder: static/img</span></span>

6

<span key="f75d6e68a426421e81e98f53b42bbceb"><span offset-key="f75d6e68a426421e81e98f53b42bbceb:0">public\_folder: /img</span></span>

7

<span key="caf783edde39486abbf1f5f3026ade13"><span offset-key="caf783edde39486abbf1f5f3026ade13:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

8

<span key="d4494b6f5704453e8eabb51a63d95a6a"><span offset-key="d4494b6f5704453e8eabb51a63d95a6a:0">collections:</span></span>

9

<span key="786d3ddb7b9b4ad7a46d72599a97b823"><span offset-key="786d3ddb7b9b4ad7a46d72599a97b823:0"> - name: 'blog'</span></span>

10

<span key="d3bbb2442e914d12a38b1526e408cc62"><span offset-key="d3bbb2442e914d12a38b1526e408cc62:0"> label: 'Blog'</span></span>

11

<span key="d038cafe13f748bd8f2e8b10187c0047"><span offset-key="d038cafe13f748bd8f2e8b10187c0047:0"> folder: 'content/blog'</span></span>

12

<span key="9260e37a1afe49449091759b3b5a367d"><span offset-key="9260e37a1afe49449091759b3b5a367d:0"> create: true</span></span>

13

<span key="af7c6671aadc49ba8a2016e99a9f4623"><span offset-key="af7c6671aadc49ba8a2016e99a9f4623:0"> slug: 'index'</span></span>

14

<span key="62519f153399430886cde1af96ecf2f5"><span offset-key="62519f153399430886cde1af96ecf2f5:0"> media\_folder: ''</span></span>

15

<span key="ece3bdf7da6f4cfdae1cdbadf9d5a803"><span offset-key="ece3bdf7da6f4cfdae1cdbadf9d5a803:0"> public\_folder: ''</span></span>

16

<span key="80bf3a5408c34ade85c47fea9ffa700d"><span offset-key="80bf3a5408c34ade85c47fea9ffa700d:0"> path: '{{title}}/index'</span></span>

17

<span key="8c36d8b78cf541bfaa92f71dac973734"><span offset-key="8c36d8b78cf541bfaa92f71dac973734:0"> editor:</span></span>

18

<span key="3a761c4e58f84972816f28d6ed368d55"><span offset-key="3a761c4e58f84972816f28d6ed368d55:0"> preview: false</span></span>

19

<span key="7e653c03ac164275a42f6cf289395cb3"><span offset-key="7e653c03ac164275a42f6cf289395cb3:0"> fields:</span></span>

20

<span key="51c2ac75109d47da89ecbcd256e10413"><span offset-key="51c2ac75109d47da89ecbcd256e10413:0"> - { label: 'Title', name: 'title', widget: 'string' }</span></span>

21

<span key="46f539ed82bb42639855a29e0bead471"><span offset-key="46f539ed82bb42639855a29e0bead471:0"> - { label: 'Publish Date', name: 'date', widget: 'datetime' }</span></span>

22

<span key="d3443c4aea594417a739e89fd14f1d5a"><span offset-key="d3443c4aea594417a739e89fd14f1d5a:0"> - { label: 'Description', name: 'description', widget: 'string' }</span></span>

23

<span key="53a581025bd34821b1128ae3caeea125"><span offset-key="53a581025bd34821b1128ae3caeea125:0"> - { label: 'Body', name: 'body', widget: 'markdown' }</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="b8fcfae8306c4db4b2f2cff274b451b0">**Note:**<span offset-key="b8fcfae8306c4db4b2f2cff274b451b0:1"> The above configuration allows assets to be stored relative to their content. Therefore posts would be stored in the format below as it is in </span>`gatsby-starter-blog`<span offset-key="b8fcfae8306c4db4b2f2cff274b451b0:3">.</span></span>

1

<span key="927e0cc6d44142b0a12e30544a3f30e3"><span offset-key="927e0cc6d44142b0a12e30544a3f30e3:0">content/</span></span>

2

<span key="03a3042bc13f468eb65e4e7c2108beda"><span offset-key="03a3042bc13f468eb65e4e7c2108beda:0">├── blog</span></span>

3

<span key="0c682ac456144d00bf785ae7b505ef36"><span offset-key="0c682ac456144d00bf785ae7b505ef36:0">│ ├── first-post-title</span></span>

4

<span key="59d026c9705e45a4934fdb5ee0b1ba7b"><span offset-key="59d026c9705e45a4934fdb5ee0b1ba7b:0">│ │ ├── index.md</span></span>

5

<span key="c01e640c47f343159179f0f7c4b8f581"><span offset-key="c01e640c47f343159179f0f7c4b8f581:0">│ │ └── post-image.jpg</span></span>

6

<span key="b628e7d7283849f58caaa9cbd3b0d417"><span offset-key="b628e7d7283849f58caaa9cbd3b0d417:0">└── └── second-post-title</span></span>

7

<span key="f21d6e872e6441c1b7a7499ea47834e2"><span offset-key="f21d6e872e6441c1b7a7499ea47834e2:0"> ├── index.md</span></span>

8

<span key="f12d3fdb05ad44a4bc1091975f3061e3"><span offset-key="f12d3fdb05ad44a4bc1091975f3061e3:0"> └── post-image.jpg</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="d4d591504e8e475d87a69df4c15be791"><span offset-key="d4d591504e8e475d87a69df4c15be791:0">Finally, add the plugin to your </span>`gatsby-config.js`<span offset-key="d4d591504e8e475d87a69df4c15be791:2">.</span></span>

1

<span key="7d0d985513cf4bdfa3b6737ba1b2b60e"><span offset-key="7d0d985513cf4bdfa3b6737ba1b2b60e:0">plugins: \[\`gatsby-plugin-netlify-cms\`\]</span></span>

Copied!

### 

<span key="1ce2288ff45f4e2b9617878ac6a71cbf"><span offset-key="1ce2288ff45f4e2b9617878ac6a71cbf:0">Push to GitHub</span></span>

<span key="ac8d0576c4484c4d8b73b08aba5d4d1d"><span offset-key="ac8d0576c4484c4d8b73b08aba5d4d1d:0">It's now time to commit your changes and push to GitHub. The Gatsby starter initializes Git automatically for you, so you only need to do:</span></span>

1

<span key="60cb7acfabb64126a677348097e8e4ce"><span offset-key="60cb7acfabb64126a677348097e8e4ce:0">git add .</span></span>

2

<span key="a7aa8b9b6c434170bd002ab62dd9104d"><span offset-key="a7aa8b9b6c434170bd002ab62dd9104d:0">git commit -m "Initial Commit"</span></span>

3

<span key="b4d72bc6fcd543ad88c3d16897aa0413"><span offset-key="b4d72bc6fcd543ad88c3d16897aa0413:0">git remote add origin https://github.com/YOUR\_USERNAME/NEW\_REPO\_NAME.git</span></span>

4

<span key="993988400e7c44e5b4c27a4902226866"><span offset-key="993988400e7c44e5b4c27a4902226866:0">git push -u origin main</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

### 

<span key="e2a42494b1b544828f7d1670dad7b97d"><span offset-key="e2a42494b1b544828f7d1670dad7b97d:0">Add your repo to Netlify</span></span>

<span key="a0b8886cdceb42a7bc2b1cc8caafcc8d"><span offset-key="a0b8886cdceb42a7bc2b1cc8caafcc8d:0">Go to Netlify and select 'New Site from Git'. Select GitHub and the repository you just pushed to. Click Configure Netlify on GitHub and give access to your repository. Finish the setup by clicking Deploy Site. Netlify will begin reading your repository and starting building your project.</span></span>

### 

<span key="9d8f668e7c2b44119d59a3230f16c73a"><span offset-key="9d8f668e7c2b44119d59a3230f16c73a:0">Enable Identity and Git Gateway</span></span>

<span key="fa72bd9afd4645b68b2a6f957577b197"><span offset-key="fa72bd9afd4645b68b2a6f957577b197:0">Netlify's Identity and Git Gateway services allow you to manage CMS admin users for your site without requiring them to have an account with your Git host or commit access on your repo. From your site dashboard on Netlify:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="332814f75163438893cfac3bef062629"><span offset-key="332814f75163438893cfac3bef062629:0">Go to </span>**Settings > Identity**<span offset-key="332814f75163438893cfac3bef062629:2">, and select </span>**Enable Identity service**<span offset-key="332814f75163438893cfac3bef062629:4">.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="9d286f5bf7f94f3da39df737aeb579c5"><span offset-key="9d286f5bf7f94f3da39df737aeb579c5:0">Under </span>**Registration preferences**<span offset-key="9d286f5bf7f94f3da39df737aeb579c5:2">, select </span>**Open**<span offset-key="9d286f5bf7f94f3da39df737aeb579c5:4"> or </span>**Invite only**<span offset-key="9d286f5bf7f94f3da39df737aeb579c5:6">. In most cases, you want only invited users to access your CMS, but if you're just experimenting, you can leave it open for convenience.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="91aa6f9d2cf742d4855caa45aa5bd7da"><span offset-key="91aa6f9d2cf742d4855caa45aa5bd7da:0">If you'd like to allow one-click login with services like Google and GitHub, check the boxes next to the services you'd like to use, under </span>**External providers**<span offset-key="91aa6f9d2cf742d4855caa45aa5bd7da:2">.</span></span>

4.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">4.</span>
    <span key="930c49601995434fad763557c735a808"><span offset-key="930c49601995434fad763557c735a808:0">Scroll down to </span>**Services > Git Gateway**<span offset-key="930c49601995434fad763557c735a808:2">, and click </span>**Enable Git Gateway**<span offset-key="930c49601995434fad763557c735a808:4">. This authenticates with your Git host and generates an API access token. In this case, we're leaving the </span>**Roles**<span offset-key="930c49601995434fad763557c735a808:6"> field blank, which means any logged in user may access the CMS. For information on changing this, check the </span></span><a href="https://www.netlify.com/docs/identity/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a830ac1458f743dd8d20bbb3b0e7d031" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="2e2943dae1864847a7f4972ad7aa1eb1"><span data-offset-key="2e2943dae1864847a7f4972ad7aa1eb1:0">Netlify Identity documentation</span></span></span></a><span key="daf72302b29748d09c14980a686386c1"><span offset-key="daf72302b29748d09c14980a686386c1:0">.</span></span>

## 

<span key="0b655a1b1cb744978dbc61fa44ff3e3e"><span offset-key="0b655a1b1cb744978dbc61fa44ff3e3e:0">Start publishing</span></span>

<span key="77b53dd165de4246a448b31425b37ef0"><span offset-key="77b53dd165de4246a448b31425b37ef0:0">It's time to create your first blog post. Login to your site's </span>`/admin/`<span offset-key="77b53dd165de4246a448b31425b37ef0:2"> page and create a new post by clicking New Blog. Add a title, a date and some text. When you click Publish, a new commit will be created in your GitHub repo with this format </span>`Create Blog “year-month-date-title”`<span offset-key="77b53dd165de4246a448b31425b37ef0:4">.</span></span>

<span key="9fa7c4306f8446628d1fccfda95b5b65"><span offset-key="9fa7c4306f8446628d1fccfda95b5b65:0">Then Netlify will detect that there was a commit in your repo, and will start rebuilding your project. When your project is deployed you'll be able to see the post you created.</span></span>

### 

<span key="51bc9ec07531444d98f4722f8e0c14b8"><span offset-key="51bc9ec07531444d98f4722f8e0c14b8:0">Cleanup</span></span>

<span key="557fd8b78bc04a2683184abaa07a64c3"><span offset-key="557fd8b78bc04a2683184abaa07a64c3:0">It is now safe to remove the default Gatsby blog posts.</span></span>

# 

<span key="3fd2b966194f4ae3a71798ecdd017512"><span offset-key="3fd2b966194f4ae3a71798ecdd017512:0">About the GraphQL API</span></span>

<span key="6a80d752e1c6489794bee8151adcd249"><span offset-key="6a80d752e1c6489794bee8151adcd249:0">The GitHub GraphQL API offers flexibility and the ability to define precisely the data you want to fetch.</span></span>

    <span key="07e9dc7a5eb64f1ba31cf819bcf29de9"><span offset-key="07e9dc7a5eb64f1ba31cf819bcf29de9:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://docs.github.com/en/graphql/guides/forming-calls-with-graphql#authenticating-with-graphql" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6b962b8c12774dc2b8ed5fdafcef3884" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="d43e2a1e9ec44d9da6bf750e258d04e6"><span data-offset-key="d43e2a1e9ec44d9da6bf750e258d04e6:0">Authentication</span></span></span></a><span key="bd85a5494f4f402099bae0c4c6a96887"><span offset-key="bd85a5494f4f402099bae0c4c6a96887:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

## 

<span key="456daf93e47e4b9a97503f33b46158c4"><span offset-key="456daf93e47e4b9a97503f33b46158c4:0">About GraphQL</span></span>

<span key="eed863f555ec4b5d99ecd506f433423f"><span offset-key="eed863f555ec4b5d99ecd506f433423f:0">The </span></span><a href="https://graphql.github.io" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="9ab5f0840ade4f8e996f510e63aa66b2" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="706f610ba6cd46d087cab22a3392450a"><span data-offset-key="706f610ba6cd46d087cab22a3392450a:0">GraphQL</span></span></span></a><span key="5f746865b27b435eaa9ca338af1cb35a"><span offset-key="5f746865b27b435eaa9ca338af1cb35a:0"> data query language is:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="90721316cc2e4730803c57cb4cc50d05">**A** </span><a href="https://graphql.github.io/graphql-spec/June2018/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="87a57eab8eda4d81b55fe8cb5588186a" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="772d3ed6939a4cc4a6d64288cf146966"><strong>specification</strong></span></span></a><span key="66a378d858b34b0e919694bd7dbb284c">**.**<span offset-key="66a378d858b34b0e919694bd7dbb284c:1"> The spec determines the validity of the </span></span><a href="https://docs.github.com/en/graphql/guides/introduction-to-graphql#schema" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6cbc8c1b168649b68c7c1be1148844d4" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="1aa10ab83f5c42c0bc7bbebf7acf6bbf"><span data-offset-key="1aa10ab83f5c42c0bc7bbebf7acf6bbf:0">schema</span></span></span></a><span key="4ddabefcbd5e412aa6dadb3cadb00023"><span offset-key="4ddabefcbd5e412aa6dadb3cadb00023:0"> on the API server. The schema determines the validity of client calls.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="6331d8e58f6b49d2be5acde448841412"><span offset-key="6331d8e58f6b49d2be5acde448841412:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://docs.github.com/en/graphql/overview/about-the-graphql-api#about-the-graphql-schema-reference" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="af60da3324514ff1af5a13e7ffca1699" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="c95ff71571c64b328e092bd8485b1f9f"><strong>Strongly typed</strong></span></span></a><span key="b8d5928e894f494a8452357a49845c89">**.**<span offset-key="b8d5928e894f494a8452357a49845c89:1"> The schema defines an API's type system and all object relationships.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="b8624ca16b86499b85de9d15d46cf457"><span offset-key="b8624ca16b86499b85de9d15d46cf457:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://docs.github.com/en/graphql/guides/introduction-to-graphql#discovering-the-graphql-api" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="25a297c4f0a04236ac1659a63692f4ad" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="e37836cd909e4300b26f5a6cf1ac61f4"><strong>Introspective</strong></span></span></a><span key="d49cbe5e4236487caa13a8d334740c0b">**.**<span offset-key="d49cbe5e4236487caa13a8d334740c0b:1"> A client can query the schema for details about the schema.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="7d9c17a234774a22bb8d1497a91f1027"><span offset-key="7d9c17a234774a22bb8d1497a91f1027:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://docs.github.com/en/graphql/guides/forming-calls-with-graphql" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6e2387ecedae4743a40b129b81cddd8e" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="d2bf3e50ae834da590cdc256a9e6ddc4"><strong>Hierarchical</strong></span></span></a><span key="b99b8c394cc74f6b81e2e832e77cbe35">**.**<span offset-key="b99b8c394cc74f6b81e2e832e77cbe35:1"> The shape of a GraphQL call mirrors the shape of the JSON data it returns. </span></span><a href="https://docs.github.com/en/graphql/guides/migrating-from-rest-to-graphql#example-nesting" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="d7521144976640949f178facabbd9f1b" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="c06dbbd736ab4f5ebce1f53989f4b597"><span data-offset-key="c06dbbd736ab4f5ebce1f53989f4b597:0">Nested fields</span></span></span></a><span key="e4d4c3a3d71f442b83978c0bb80a32b7"><span offset-key="e4d4c3a3d71f442b83978c0bb80a32b7:0"> let you query for and receive only the data you specify in a single round trip.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="4ad01998abdc49038ffc2410edf61c5f">**An application layer.**<span offset-key="4ad01998abdc49038ffc2410edf61c5f:1"> GraphQL is not a storage model or a database query language. The </span>*graph*<span offset-key="4ad01998abdc49038ffc2410edf61c5f:3"> refers to graph structures defined in the schema, where </span></span><a href="https://docs.github.com/en/graphql/guides/introduction-to-graphql#node" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="583258c7532a454ba7282abeb267e666" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="1ffb8246ff454d5e81c567dcb68bdf18"><span data-offset-key="1ffb8246ff454d5e81c567dcb68bdf18:0">nodes</span></span></span></a><span key="9240cb5026bf4d618d0a2480482c4661"><span offset-key="9240cb5026bf4d618d0a2480482c4661:0"> define objects and </span></span><a href="https://docs.github.com/en/graphql/guides/introduction-to-graphql#edge" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="c5794a02230c4a84ad7027d564739339" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="c242d67c724742928c2ac1377ade03a7"><span data-offset-key="c242d67c724742928c2ac1377ade03a7:0">edges</span></span></span></a><span key="be611e137fb3462f8fbffddc81c1d687"><span offset-key="be611e137fb3462f8fbffddc81c1d687:0"> define relationships between objects. The API traverses and returns application data based on the schema definitions, independent of how the data is stored.</span></span>

## 

<span key="7e0139f1534c46c3a84219cc1351d26f"><span offset-key="7e0139f1534c46c3a84219cc1351d26f:0">Why GitHub is using GraphQL</span></span>

<span key="304f6028bac64352b0a28f1e9b5e5312"><span offset-key="304f6028bac64352b0a28f1e9b5e5312:0">GitHub chose GraphQL for our API v4 because it offers significantly more flexibility for our integrators. The ability to define precisely the data you want—and </span>*only*<span offset-key="304f6028bac64352b0a28f1e9b5e5312:2"> the data you want—is a powerful advantage over the REST API v3 endpoints. GraphQL lets you replace multiple REST requests with </span>*a single call*<span offset-key="304f6028bac64352b0a28f1e9b5e5312:4"> to fetch the data you specify.</span></span>

<span key="ff3e095405fe46eabe77e22e86d6e24b"><span offset-key="ff3e095405fe46eabe77e22e86d6e24b:0">For more details about why GitHub has moved to GraphQL, see the original </span></span><a href="https://githubengineering.com/the-github-graphql-api/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="c692b577a89449ab9447f1c32cbc7074" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="d4bc0930b20e4680b6b9d7f6ce2f3997"><span data-offset-key="d4bc0930b20e4680b6b9d7f6ce2f3997:0">announcement blog post</span></span></span></a><span key="0f78fbc4cf444ee0bc2ff85eefdf16ce"><span offset-key="0f78fbc4cf444ee0bc2ff85eefdf16ce:0">.</span></span>

## 

<span key="b68aa7eb59dc4a7a8e95ebea782efa0c"><span offset-key="b68aa7eb59dc4a7a8e95ebea782efa0c:0">About the GraphQL schema reference</span></span>

<span key="0568813e8daa4eeea942c2592d0b6100"><span offset-key="0568813e8daa4eeea942c2592d0b6100:0">The docs in the sidebar are generated from the GitHub GraphQL </span></span><a href="https://docs.github.com/en/graphql/guides/introduction-to-graphql#discovering-the-graphql-api" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="39afda68622e47a88e55d0bfef55f7f6" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="4e27f29ccaaa4236b9971c8d8b88a4dd"><span data-offset-key="4e27f29ccaaa4236b9971c8d8b88a4dd:0">schema</span></span></span></a><span key="9611ff2da406496998dd8070c8672491"><span offset-key="9611ff2da406496998dd8070c8672491:0">. All calls are validated and executed against the schema. Use these docs to find out what data you can call:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="8419f0cec1394dcba1b53892225d2785"><span offset-key="8419f0cec1394dcba1b53892225d2785:0">Allowed operations: </span></span><a href="https://docs.github.com/en/graphql/reference/queries" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6bcdcd298fc540a5ae2cd82e4b366733" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="d800805eda7b4622989fd1e2e3f7cd36"><span data-offset-key="d800805eda7b4622989fd1e2e3f7cd36:0">queries</span></span></span></a><span key="e86d7c6cfaef46ff825e81cbf9749844"><span offset-key="e86d7c6cfaef46ff825e81cbf9749844:0"> and </span></span><a href="https://docs.github.com/en/graphql/reference/mutations" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e545dd14bddc4c01a24378935f646ef9" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="aa8b5c550cbf404a8d10837c7b9d572f"><span data-offset-key="aa8b5c550cbf404a8d10837c7b9d572f:0">mutations</span></span></span></a><span key="ecb0827fd6c24af3b1ca2b6a39a91f61"><span offset-key="ecb0827fd6c24af3b1ca2b6a39a91f61:0">.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="842ccf9f13174d1da1855263387286ff"><span offset-key="842ccf9f13174d1da1855263387286ff:0">Schema-defined types: </span></span><a href="https://docs.github.com/en/graphql/reference/scalars" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="543d804aa05b4cad98af635731b6a7e5" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="d1c9760abb4a458bb1df87820f4b9495"><span data-offset-key="d1c9760abb4a458bb1df87820f4b9495:0">scalars</span></span></span></a><span key="3856c17a6b3946f8933c9c0154b91ce6"><span offset-key="3856c17a6b3946f8933c9c0154b91ce6:0">, </span></span><a href="https://docs.github.com/en/graphql/reference/objects" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6ac2bad9a71d4634995bd7e76a5f3824" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="dc248dec99914a92878056d968dab3a4"><span data-offset-key="dc248dec99914a92878056d968dab3a4:0">objects</span></span></span></a><span key="7f6fb38f74594fd588d6143badd546d4"><span offset-key="7f6fb38f74594fd588d6143badd546d4:0">, </span></span><a href="https://docs.github.com/en/graphql/reference/enums" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="9574aed936af4fd99a4415a9c4f3e35f" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="32bdfcee6277425091c95ec4fbeef4f0"><span data-offset-key="32bdfcee6277425091c95ec4fbeef4f0:0">enums</span></span></span></a><span key="34afc982abaa449c986bbae45c6295af"><span offset-key="34afc982abaa449c986bbae45c6295af:0">, </span></span><a href="https://docs.github.com/en/graphql/reference/interfaces" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="2990a73907574339a4de690ee13da5c3" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="230ffddba10749f5990d5611d2c509de"><span data-offset-key="230ffddba10749f5990d5611d2c509de:0">interfaces</span></span></span></a><span key="60b8a676e1ca4585b8a30b75ef69c65a"><span offset-key="60b8a676e1ca4585b8a30b75ef69c65a:0">, </span></span><a href="https://docs.github.com/en/graphql/reference/unions" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-offset-key="e13bdc406996494a983d41c58700b78f:0">input objects</span></span></span></a><span key="622dfc3fe8224ac8bff777aea5c5f75b"><span <span key="8ded84e9795d45c9954262b1edee0f6a"><span offset-key="8ded84e9795d45c9954262b1edee0f6a:0">You can access this same content via the </span></span><a href="https://docs.github.com/en/graphql/guides/using-the-explorer#accessing-the-sidebar-docs" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="053038da5b77467b9a867fea8ba7c72e" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="f39391e6360542ddb49d3778ac431e3b"><span data-offset-key="f39391e6360542ddb49d3778ac431e3b:0">Explorer Docs sidebar</span></span></span></a><span key="16a26936439949dd92b7ba9a37a67004"><span offset-key="16a26936439949dd92b7ba9a37a67004:0">. Note that you may need to rely on both the docs and the schema validation to successfully call the GraphQL API.</span></span>

<span key="50c0a41cb76540da932b75a5597e32ca"><span offset-key="50c0a41cb76540da932b75a5597e32ca:0">For other information, such as authentication and rate limit details, check out the </span></span><a href="https://docs.github.com/en/graphql/guides" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="590601340b0f4545b6c48056e3db14cf" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="459cea0ee8384a1ea974780a443ffc5e"><span data-offset-key="459cea0ee8384a1ea974780a443ffc5e:0">guides</span></span></span></a><span key="ab2a1d65289041cfa58e603b17dee0ed"><span offset-key="ab2a1d65289041cfa58e603b17dee0ed:0">.</span></span>

The forum is moderated and maintained by GitHub staff, but questions posted to the forum are not guaranteed to receive a reply from GitHub staff.</span></span>

# 

<span key="aefa2c2fb9bb497cb5beb26a8c46f4ee"><span offset-key="aefa2c2fb9bb497cb5beb26a8c46f4ee:0">Overview</span></span>

<span key="4fa0301fa8824540b5a6062fea821137"><span offset-key="4fa0301fa8824540b5a6062fea821137:0">A backend is JavaScript code that allows Netlify CMS to communicate with a service that stores content - typically a Git host like GitHub or GitLab. It provides functions that Netlify CMS can use to do things like read and update files using API's provided by the service.</span></span>

## 

<span key="019d431a6a9942df99efc93c53935b9d"><span offset-key="019d431a6a9942df99efc93c53935b9d:0">Backend Configuration</span></span>

<span key="be25b87717104d8f96df7d00c8497b40"><span offset-key="be25b87717104d8f96df7d00c8497b40:0">Individual backends should provide their own configuration documentation, but there are some configuration options that are common to multiple backends. A full reference is below. Note that these are properties of the </span>`backend`<span offset-key="be25b87717104d8f96df7d00c8497b40:2"> field, and should be nested under that field.</span></span>

Field

Default

Description

<span key="260b14a6309a411d8e976b3711e08faa">`repo`</span>

<span key="14b80bef9f324e6d81e3ca278ca7e43e"><span offset-key="14b80bef9f324e6d81e3ca278ca7e43e:0">none</span></span>

<span key="0d65eb542d09498cb5d69aabc2f4d347">**Required**<span offset-key="0d65eb542d09498cb5d69aabc2f4d347:1"> for </span>`github`<span offset-key="0d65eb542d09498cb5d69aabc2f4d347:3">, </span>`gitlab`<span offset-key="0d65eb542d09498cb5d69aabc2f4d347:5">, and </span>`bitbucket`<span offset-key="0d65eb542d09498cb5d69aabc2f4d347:7"> backends; ignored by </span>`git-gateway`<span offset-key="0d65eb542d09498cb5d69aabc2f4d347:9">. Follows the pattern </span>`[org-or-username]/[repo-name]`<span offset-key="0d65eb542d09498cb5d69aabc2f4d347:11">.</span></span>

<span key="6a771d6dc54b4ab59bff704e2f6afd49">`branch`</span>

<span key="911ca3b27e264ba0bf97c6a0b2f84351">`master`</span>

<span key="ccf64d6ade0a43248a647139662b2ed3"><span offset-key="ccf64d6ade0a43248a647139662b2ed3:0">The branch where published content is stored. All CMS commits and PRs are made to this branch.</span></span>

<span key="225ce9b0003543be8766095119031272">`api_root`</span>

<span key="b739c04da691454fb20c022206d47da9">`https://api.github.com`<span offset-key="b739c04da691454fb20c022206d47da9:1"> (GitHub), </span>`https://gitlab.com/api/v4`<span offset-key="b739c04da691454fb20c022206d47da9:3"> (GitLab), or </span>`https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0`<span offset-key="b739c04da691454fb20c022206d47da9:5"> (Bitbucket)</span></span>

<span key="84117e323b804423a196d79a9a397dc1"><span offset-key="84117e323b804423a196d79a9a397dc1:0">The API endpoint. Only necessary in certain cases, like with GitHub Enterprise or self-hosted GitLab.</span></span>

<span key="2b811208a5c34a69a7c4bc8f3610e827">`site_domain`</span>

<span key="e8abbbeda4a145049a68eb19bb2931d5">`location.hostname`<span offset-key="e8abbbeda4a145049a68eb19bb2931d5:1"> (or </span>`cms.netlify.com`<span offset-key="e8abbbeda4a145049a68eb19bb2931d5:3"> when on </span>`localhost`<span offset-key="e8abbbeda4a145049a68eb19bb2931d5:5">)</span></span>

<span key="bb6aa4f12a704767bbab78556664d75a"><span offset-key="bb6aa4f12a704767bbab78556664d75a:0">Sets the </span>`site_id`<span offset-key="bb6aa4f12a704767bbab78556664d75a:2"> query param sent to the API endpoint. Non-Netlify auth setups will often need to set this for local development to work properly.</span></span>

<span key="695170d0fb674a19b3e98a00e7559135">`base_url`</span>

<span key="a0289398250242c88a5949bbfa06d25a">`https://api.netlify.com`<span offset-key="a0289398250242c88a5949bbfa06d25a:1"> (GitHub, Bitbucket) or </span>`https://gitlab.com`<span offset-key="a0289398250242c88a5949bbfa06d25a:3"> (GitLab)</span></span>

<span key="ce3bd9c1478f4e539615ff1fde3b5df5"><span offset-key="ce3bd9c1478f4e539615ff1fde3b5df5:0">OAuth client hostname (just the base domain, no path). </span>**Required**<span offset-key="ce3bd9c1478f4e539615ff1fde3b5df5:2"> when using an external OAuth server or self-hosted GitLab.</span></span>

<span key="00e8dd7b2f134c6191f595bb90974277">`auth_endpoint`</span>

<span key="0c1b03df654344a08a394bb6fce70276">`auth`<span offset-key="0c1b03df654344a08a394bb6fce70276:1"> (GitHub, Bitbucket) or </span>`oauth/authorize`<span offset-key="0c1b03df654344a08a394bb6fce70276:3"> (GitLab)</span></span>

<span key="dadf73ff9459452391b125dea4d9623f"><span offset-key="dadf73ff9459452391b125dea4d9623f:0">Path to append to </span>`base_url`<span offset-key="dadf73ff9459452391b125dea4d9623f:2"> for authentication requests. Optional.</span></span>

<span key="356d6dd3f4c84ac4bad2594dc21eebca">`cms_label_prefix`</span>

<span key="fcea73d3cf6e46c8ae6d638e21259612">`netlify-cms/`</span>

<span key="e718144de4a14b4fab15d1d705713a82"><span offset-key="e718144de4a14b4fab15d1d705713a82:0">Pull (or Merge) Requests label prefix when using editorial workflow. Optional.</span></span>

## 

<span key="2d072131504c4d1c9f0f71ecef980b91"><span offset-key="2d072131504c4d1c9f0f71ecef980b91:0">Creating a New Backend</span></span>

<span key="04fae6c0c61042d1938da55e510cebfb"><span offset-key="04fae6c0c61042d1938da55e510cebfb:0">Anyone can write a backend, but we don't yet have a finalized and documented API. If you would like to write your own backend for a service that does not have one currently, we recommend using the </span></span><a href="https://github.com/netlify/netlify-cms/tree/master/packages/netlify-cms-backend-github" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="8d02295ae9634417b681868728c24296" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="0ae99a9da59e4b678271b2ba01d2543a"><span data-offset-key="0ae99a9da59e4b678271b2ba01d2543a:0">GitHub backend</span></span></span></a><span key="1703890494af4635bcdac1655689ffc4"><span offset-key="1703890494af4635bcdac1655689ffc4:0"> as a reference for API and best practices.</span></span>

# 

<span key="247204c333554b6ca0e55b728916c126"><span offset-key="247204c333554b6ca0e55b728916c126:0">Creating Custom Widgets</span></span>

<span key="4d2510e5f6454285a4a8a34a440a4bfc"><span offset-key="4d2510e5f6454285a4a8a34a440a4bfc:0">The NetlifyCMS exposes a </span>`window.CMS`<span offset-key="4d2510e5f6454285a4a8a34a440a4bfc:2"> a global object that you can use to register custom widgets, previews, and editor plugins. The same object is also the default export if you import Netlify CMS as an npm module. The available widget extension methods are:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="4d97606b9a344745804b44149e30f802">**registerWidget:**<span offset-key="4d97606b9a344745804b44149e30f802:1"> registers a custom widget.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="dfaffedb116e40509759fd5a1423d423">**registerEditorComponent:**<span offset-key="dfaffedb116e40509759fd5a1423d423:1"> adds a block component to the Markdown editor.</span></span>

### 

<span key="806d0fed5ec44a85b4be3c2809648451"><span offset-key="806d0fed5ec44a85b4be3c2809648451:0">Writing React Components inline</span></span>

<span key="6714174fc165464d86cd18e237709ead"><span offset-key="6714174fc165464d86cd18e237709ead:0">The </span>`registerWidget`<span offset-key="6714174fc165464d86cd18e237709ead:2"> requires you to provide a React component. If you have a build process in place for your project, it is possible to integrate with this build process.</span></span>

<span key="a7eacc054c784a11b901062249bcf78b"><span offset-key="a7eacc054c784a11b901062249bcf78b:0">However, although possible, it may be cumbersome or even impractical to add a React build phase. For this reason, NetlifyCMS exposes two constructs globally to allow you to create components inline: ‘createClass’ and ‘h’ (alias for React.createElement).</span></span>

## 

<span key="46c51d1969c342b0bf2a242a2f4aecd8">`registerWidget`</span>

<span key="4ff7dc17204b4a29a3c0f8fa9d884dd7"><span offset-key="4ff7dc17204b4a29a3c0f8fa9d884dd7:0">Register a custom widget.</span></span>

1

<span key="0107ae13d09647ebbe397d2e014785ad"><span offset-key="0107ae13d09647ebbe397d2e014785ad:0">// Using global window object</span></span>

2

<span key="dcb84f819a894f5e8a3bfc3c75e8c32b"><span offset-key="dcb84f819a894f5e8a3bfc3c75e8c32b:0">CMS.registerWidget(name, control, \[preview\], \[schema\]);</span></span>

3

<span key="fbcde0ad29b545ad989f9b94140c26aa"><span offset-key="fbcde0ad29b545ad989f9b94140c26aa:0"> // Patterns are run in a multline environment (against the entire markdown document),</span></span>

23

<span key="41125f7c767545e099e4faf137dd2503"><span offset-key="41125f7c767545e099e4faf137dd2503:0"> // and so generally should make use of the multiline flag (\`m\`). If you need to capture</span></span>

<span key="5d2c8d2fcaf14c0897699abeb7b564bd"><span offset-key="5d2c8d2fcaf14c0897699abeb7b564bd:0"> // \`(\[\\S\\s\]\*)\`, or you can additionally enable the "dot all" flag (\`s\`),</span></span>

<span key="4b6d399285814c68be3b88e8e42efa84"><span offset-key="4b6d399285814c68be3b88e8e42efa84:0"> // which will cause \`(.\*)\` to match newlines as well.</span></span>

## 

<span key="e753c0f555b5418eba1b4b421694dc5e"><span offset-key="e753c0f555b5418eba1b4b421694dc5e:0">Advanced field validation</span></span>

<span key="9a9ab2660f16415e93b82188e3b75b5b"><span offset-key="9a9ab2660f16415e93b82188e3b75b5b:0">All widget fields, including those for built-in widgets, </span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/widgets/#common-widget-options" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="ff8f2bf2029e4fd99141b8d33fda3c63" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-7861_259-7862-237__"><span data-key="35c4848248614858b4d015487fc75120"><span data-offset-key="35c4848248614858b4d015487fc75120:0">include basic validation</span></span></span></a><span key="a6cbf16a5d864ac2addfd0c06e664fc8"><span offset-key="a6cbf16a5d864ac2addfd0c06e664fc8:0"> capability using the </span>`required`<span offset-key="a6cbf16a5d864ac2addfd0c06e664fc8:2"> and </span>`pattern`<span offset-key="a6cbf16a5d864ac2addfd0c06e664fc8:4"> options.</span></span>

<span key="121c7c3f4dd444418875ea6320c928e5"><span offset-key="121c7c3f4dd444418875ea6320c928e5:0">With custom widgets, the widget control can also optionally implement an </span>`isValid`<span offset-key="121c7c3f4dd444418875ea6320c928e5:2"> method to perform custom validations, in addition to presence and pattern. The </span>`isValid`<span offset-key="121c7c3f4dd444418875ea6320c928e5:4"> method will be automatically called, and it can return either a boolean value, an object with an error message or a promise. Examples:</span></span>

<span key="38fd678b55434c3a9461e22375b716e5">**Boolean**<span offset-key="38fd678b55434c3a9461e22375b716e5:1"> No errors:</span></span>

2

4

<span key="934b59b3c40a49e2a1362b626665ca56"><span offset-key="934b59b3c40a49e2a1362b626665ca56:0"> };</span></span>

<span key="ae519ad2b71e4c9d91bbba01ee1fb7ae">**Promise**<span offset-key="ae519ad2b71e4c9d91bbba01ee1fb7ae:1"> You can also return a promise from </span>`isValid`<span offset-key="ae519ad2b71e4c9d91bbba01ee1fb7ae:3">. While the promise is pending, the widget will be marked as "in error". When the promise resolves, the error is automatically cleared.</span></span>

<span key="ec0eaa7568664ae198bca14580fb6d05">**Note:**<span offset-key="ec0eaa7568664ae198bca14580fb6d05:1"> Do not create a promise inside </span>`isValid`<span offset-key="ec0eaa7568664ae198bca14580fb6d05:3"> - </span>`isValid`<span offset-key="ec0eaa7568664ae198bca14580fb6d05:5"> is called right before trying to persist. This means that even if a previous promise was already resolved, when the user hits 'save', </span>`isValid`<span offset-key="ec0eaa7568664ae198bca14580fb6d05:7"> will be called again. If it returns a new promise, it will be immediately marked as "in error" until the new promise resolves.</span></span>

## 

<span key="ed229c9614dd4185acdd58ca789da4df"><span offset-key="ed229c9614dd4185acdd58ca789da4df:0">Writing custom widgets as a separate package</span></span>

<span key="e1f73fe9410048e18b2f3890f3d17ef7"><span offset-key="e1f73fe9410048e18b2f3890f3d17ef7:0">Widgets are inputs for the Netlify CMS editor interface. It's a React component that receives user input and outputs a serialized value. Those are the only rules - the component can be extremely simple, like text input, or extremely complicated, like a full-blown markdown editor. They can make calls to external services, and generally do anything that JavaScript can do.</span></span>

<span key="5bce28c8de7f44779ca30067555d8094"><span offset-key="5bce28c8de7f44779ca30067555d8094:0">For writing custom widgets as a separate package you should follow these steps:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="8f5f784404be429482e10523f462790f"><span offset-key="8f5f784404be429482e10523f462790f:0">Create a directory</span></span>

    1

    <span key="ac42a2f0c0cb471eb7bbb8f28aabebd5"><span offset-key="ac42a2f0c0cb471eb7bbb8f28aabebd5:0">mkdir my-custom-widget</span></span>

    <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

    Copied!

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="c842dbf2f6414cb597e01cdfbe1df709"><span offset-key="c842dbf2f6414cb597e01cdfbe1df709:0">Navigate to the directory</span></span>

    1

    <span key="4fff4245c428419da5e8a5b2dff10f33"><span offset-key="4fff4245c428419da5e8a5b2dff10f33:0">cd my-custom-widget</span></span>

    <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

    Copied!

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="693534effa3343baaffba2fad8318710"><span offset-key="693534effa3343baaffba2fad8318710:0">For setting up a new npm package run this command:</span></span>

    <span key="0c388ddd193345df913661112c103fa6"><span offset-key="0c388ddd193345df913661112c103fa6:0">Answer the questions in the command line questionnaire.</span></span>

    <span key="9ea989d012b84bd6bb006f19ad7da467"><span offset-key="9ea989d012b84bd6bb006f19ad7da467:0">In order to build React components, we need to set up a build step. We'll be using Webpack. Please run the following commands to install the required dependencies:</span></span>

<span key="0bdd617f05d642d4967cf1d049160c01"><span offset-key="0bdd617f05d642d4967cf1d049160c01:0">And you should manually add "</span>**peerDependencies**<span offset-key="0bdd617f05d642d4967cf1d049160c01:2">" and "</span>**scripts**<span offset-key="0bdd617f05d642d4967cf1d049160c01:4">" as shown below.</span></span>

<span key="e6075d878ce44096a42462b2abb78a21"><span offset-key="e6075d878ce44096a42462b2abb78a21:0">Here is the content of </span>`package.json`<span offset-key="e6075d878ce44096a42462b2abb78a21:2"> that you will have at the end:</span></span>

1

    <span key="f7f9b060782544b381b5a239983b8277"><span offset-key="f7f9b060782544b381b5a239983b8277:0">The </span>`.babelrc`<span offset-key="f7f9b060782544b381b5a239983b8277:2"> file is our local configuration for our code in the project.     <span key="07df7df1bff24470a74d7503f48b982b"><span offset-key="07df7df1bff24470a74d7503f48b982b:0">For discoverability, ensure that your package name follows the pattern </span>`netlify-cms-widget-<name>`<span offset-key="07df7df1bff24470a74d7503f48b982b:2">.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="15a1667db49e497ca79343702ce483ab"><span offset-key="15a1667db49e497ca79343702ce483ab:0">Delete this </span>`README.md`<span offset-key="15a1667db49e497ca79343702ce483ab:2">, rename </span>`README_TEMPLATE.md`<span offset-key="15a1667db49e497ca79343702ce483ab:4"> to </span>`README.md`<span offset-key="15a1667db49e497ca79343702ce483ab:6">, and update the new file for your specific widget.</span></span>

4.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">4.</span>
    <span key="68859bac9fa64f14b3107e1f04187c52"><span offset-key="68859bac9fa64f14b3107e1f04187c52:0">Rename the exports in </span>`src/index.js`<span offset-key="68859bac9fa64f14b3107e1f04187c52:2">. For example, if your widget is </span>`netlify-cms-widget-awesome`<span offset-key="68859bac9fa64f14b3107e1f04187c52:4">, you would do:</span></span>

1

<span key="ead6ecc1683d4d9a9379e2ceb2fffb76"><span offset-key="ead6ecc1683d4d9a9379e2ceb2fffb76:0">if (typeof window !== 'undefined') {</span></span>

2

<span key="f7d44386f6f04629a2097954a8f21aca"><span offset-key="f7d44386f6f04629a2097954a8f21aca:0"> window.AwesomeControl = Control</span></span>

3

<span key="255a3794d6994e0f955c536cbd8ae486"><span offset-key="255a3794d6994e0f955c536cbd8ae486:0"> window.AwesomePreview = Preview</span></span>

4

<span key="1dba95ba81434e578851b55903cd7c63"><span offset-key="1dba95ba81434e578851b55903cd7c63:0">}</span></span>

5

<span key="444013bac9fc45e99c9f2e50ab69fc77"><span offset-key="444013bac9fc45e99c9f2e50ab69fc77:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

6

<span key="3202f9f1cf2244789efd60b5ef83ce89"><span offset-key="3202f9f1cf2244789efd60b5ef83ce89:0">export { Control as AwesomeControl, Preview as AwesomePreview }</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="b6855afeed354ed9ab1fd5a4f2ab3e00"><span offset-key="b6855afeed354ed9ab1fd5a4f2ab3e00:0">Optional: customize the component and file names in </span>`src`<span offset-key="b6855afeed354ed9ab1fd5a4f2ab3e00:2">.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="a743cbe798444090aa2ccf07f563916d"><span offset-key="a743cbe798444090aa2ccf07f563916d:0">If you haven't already, push your repo to your GitHub account so the source available to other developers.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="a800693020d1418bb1654878a6dd426f"><span offset-key="a800693020d1418bb1654878a6dd426f:0">Create a production build, which will be output to </span>`dist`<span offset-key="a800693020d1418bb1654878a6dd426f:2">:</span></span>

1

<span key="cc4e2d71eb7049e0acc7e4537b806bbc"><span offset-key="cc4e2d71eb7049e0acc7e4537b806bbc:0">npm run build</span></span>

    <span key="1cab5708ca2b43cb9d9ff8ebcf7608e0"><span offset-key="1cab5708ca2b43cb9d9ff8ebcf7608e0:0">Finally, if you're sure things are tested and working, publish!</span></span>
